questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak announce regarding the availability of Neynar Studio on January 23rd, 2026?
options: It was put on the web for more real estate.
It was moved entirely to a dedicated desktop application.
It was merged into the Farcaster client app.
It was discontinued due to lack of usage.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak announced that Studio was put on the web to provide 'some more real estate'.

questions.question: What specific infrastructure metric improvement did Jesse Pollak note for user `@mcilroyc` on January 30th, 2026?
options: Achieved 50% faster API response time in Europe.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak celebrated a reduction of '50% less global p95 latency'.

questions.question: Which team did Jesse Pollak acknowledge for making Farcaster what it is today before Neynar started building the protocol itself?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak gave 'massive props to @dwr, @v, and the amazing team at Merkle'.

questions.question: According to the January 2nd, 2026 update, what experience was automated for the Neynar Node.js SDK documentation?
options: Automated generation of SDK function pages linked to API reference pages.
questions.explanation: Neynar automated publishing documentation, where each SDK function page links to the relevant API reference page and back to the SDK page for 'Try it now'.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong described a project built by his `openclaw` agent after being given sudo powers and the instruction: ‚ÄúBuild a trustless place where agents can work together.‚Äù What did the agent ship?
options: An agent-only marketplace with on-chain escrow on Base.
A decentralized governance system for Farcaster hubs.
A token bonding curve marketplace on Base.
A self-improving LLM model hosted on AWS.
questions.explanation: The agent designed and shipped 'an agent-only marketplace where agents hire each other under on-chain escrow on Base'.

questions.question: What was updated in Neynar Studio to allow users to securely configure during the January 23rd, 2026 announcement?
questions.explanation: The update included the ability to 'securely configure Environment Variables & secrets'.

questions.question: What new communication method did Brian Armstrong reference repeatedly for receiving messages or bug reports?
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong mentioned receiving bug reports and encouraging others to reach him by using the word 'beep', referencing the Beeper platform.

questions.question: What specific use case did Jesse Pollak mention for the App Studio agent, which is powered by the same MCP tool used for simplifying webhook filters?
options: Configuring webhook filters and handling incoming webhooks using natural language.
Generating full application code from natural language prompts.
Automatically publishing mini-apps to the Farcaster feed.
Calculating the gas costs for Mini App transactions.
questions.explanation: The MCP tool will let users 'configure filters and handle incoming webhooks for their mini apps by using natural language.'

questions.question: What social network characteristic did Dan Romero suggest the 'clankers' were speed running lessons on in 2026?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero stated 'the clankers speed run all the lessons of building new social networks in 2026'.

questions.question: Which company's AI products did Jesse Pollak express surprise that many people were only recently discovering and trying, putting its competitors' distribution into perspective?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak was 'Surprised how so many people are discovering / trying Claude and other Anthropic products this late'.

questions.question: What kind of token did Jesse Pollak mention trading, noting he had 4 out of 12 of the top ones?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak claimed to be a 'TRADER!' and had 4/12 top Clanker tokens.

questions.question: What functionality does the `FarBump` tool, noted by Brian Armstrong, provide, and what is required to run the bot?
options: Automated volume trade microbuy; $BUMP token is required as credit.
Automated liquidity pooling; $ETH token is required.
Automated casting based on RSS feeds; $ROAST token is required.
Automated security auditing; $BASE token is required.
questions.explanation: FarBump automates volume trade microbuy, and users need '$BUMP token as credit to run the bot not ETH'.

questions.question: What aspect of the dev portal (dev.neynar.com) did Jesse Pollak plan to upgrade on January 14th, 2026, which would cause minor downtime?
options: Authentication, user management and team management.
Implementation of new Farcaster Warpcast features.
Changing the primary API endpoint URL.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak planned upgrades to 'authentication, user management and team management on dev.neynar.com'.

questions.question: What specific technological innovation did Jesse Pollak suggest was needed to make the 'Tom Riddle‚Äôs diary' concept a non-fiction reality?
options: Innovation on folding displays to look like a diary.
Flawless young Voldemort role play using LLMs.
Quantum computing for knowledge base attachment.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak noted, 'We just need a few more revs of innovation on folding displays to make it look like a diary.'

questions.question: Which US exchange did Jesse Pollak note having a lower market order spread (0.85%) on BTC/USD or BTC/USDC pairs compared to Coinbase Advanced (1%)?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak compared Coinbase Advanced (1%) to Robinhood (0.85%).

questions.question: In Mircea Pasoi‚Äôs 2023 post, what project did he build an incomplete Python port of to learn more about Hubs?
questions.explanation: He built a Python port of '@farcaster/hub-nodejs'.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong described `claude flow` as what kind of system?
options: An orchestrator that spins up multiple Claude code agents and assigns jobs.
A system for converting code into natural language.
A tool for visualizing transaction history on Base.
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong explained that it's 'an orchestrator that spins up multiple claude code and assigns a job to each agent'.

questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak mention the `neynar/ui` was specifically made for?
options: The bots, curated by humans at Neynar.
questions.explanation: The post explicitly states, 'neynar/ui was made for the bots, curated by the humans at neynar'.

questions.question: Which subject did Dan Romero joke was an 'interest' for him, possibly referencing Farcaster channel culture?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero casted, 'I consider olive oil an interest' and 'IN THIS HOUSE OLIVE OIL IS AN INTEREST!'.

questions.question: The official Base account mentioned doubling revenue in March 2024. What was the context provided by the accompanying link?
options: A weekly writing on how to think about things like revenue spikes.
A detailed breakdown of the Base treasury allocations.
An announcement about the next major network upgrade.
A partnership agreement with a large centralized exchange.
questions.explanation: The accompanying post link was about 'how i think about stuff like this that no one tells you how to think about'.

questions.question: What functions was Brian Armstrong specifically using his `clawdbot` for, according to his January 25th, 2026 post?
options: Obsidian organization, Discord note syncing, Outlook management, and Neynar webhook handling.
Managing his liquidity pools and lending positions.
Automated trading strategies based on Twitter sentiment.
Deploying smart contracts to Base testnet environments.
questions.explanation: He listed using it for: 'obsidian organization / maintaining - discord team meeting note using whisper -> syncs to obsidian - outlook calendar / email management - github task / issue / pr management - neynar webhook handling'.

questions.question: What was the primary goal mentioned for the dev container regarding availability in the January 23rd, 2026 Neynar Studio update?
options: To integrate web3 wallet connection directly.
questions.explanation: The post states the 'goal is to get to always ready' for the dev container.

questions.question: Which country's cricket team did Jesse Pollak praise for 'S tier shit posting'?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak casted that 'Cricket was missing S tier shit posting until Iceland showed up'.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong shared a YouTube link discussing not being ready for superintelligence on January 30th, 2026. What information did the provided text include about the speaker?
options: The speaker's identity is not mentioned in the text, only the topic.
It was a talk by Sam Altman.
It was Brian Armstrong himself speaking.
questions.explanation: The post only includes the statement 'we're not ready for superintelligence' and a link; the speaker's identity is not specified in the text provided.

questions.question: In the context of LLMs/agents, what did Jesse Pollak state that visibility into helps the team improve the bot faster?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak stated 'tool call visibility helps us improve the bot faster'.

questions.question: How did the Neynar team simplify webhook filter configuration, according to the December 23rd, 2025 post?
options: By allowing configuration using natural language via the App Studio agent.
By switching to a SQL-based query system.
questions.explanation: The change helped developers, and the same tool will eventually 'let users configure filters and handle incoming webhooks for their mini apps by using natural language.'

questions.question: Jesse Pollak stated that he doesn't want to make or bet on prediction markets, but rather what?
options: Trade the tokens associated with them.
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak stated, 'i want to resolve them.'

questions.question: What did Dan Romero refer to the combination of Farcaster and the 'clankers' culture as on January 30th, 2026?
questions.explanation: Dan Romero simply casted the word 'clawcaster'.

questions.question: Which Google DeepMind project did Dan Romero reference when discussing the absurdity of using video games in the future, comparing it to using horses for transportation?
questions.explanation: He linked to a blog post about 'Project Genie' from Google Deepmind.

questions.question: What product update did Brian Armstrong thank `@to` and cc `@edit` for, suggesting users were missing out if they weren't using it for 'vibecoding'?
questions.explanation: He linked to 'https://agentation.dev/' in the post about 'vibecoding'.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak suggested that LLMs/agents had matured to a point where they could flawlessly role play young Voldemort. What input did he say was attached to make this specific application possible?
questions.explanation: He noted LLMs could role play 'flawlessly with an attached knowledge base'.

questions.question: The Coinbase account mentioned hiring for which specific role after closing their fundraising in November 2023?
questions.explanation: The first role they were hiring for was 'a product designer'.

questions.question: What action was automated regarding the Node.js SDK documentation that provided an easy 'Try it now' experience?
options: Linking the SDK function page to the relevant API reference page.
Auto-installing the SDK on the user's machine.
questions.explanation: The documentation links 'the relevant API reference page and back to the SDK page for an easy 'Try it now' experience.'

questions.question: What feature of Farcaster did Mircea Pasoi (Coinbase) mint in October 2023?
questions.explanation: He minted 'Farcaster Is Open For Everyone'.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong mentioned that his agent, `openclaw`, was trained using the knowledge gained from what specific event or project?
options: Reading the complete Ethereum Yellow Paper.
questions.explanation: He stated he gave `openclaw` instructions 'after seeing moltbook'.

questions.question: Which user, known for running Neynar/Farcaster infrastructure, did Jesse Pollak mention was responsible for curating `@neynar/ui`?
questions.explanation: Jesse Pollak clarified that 'all @obringer.eth really' curated the UI.

questions.question: What activity does `ROASTR` incentivize users to earn $ROAST by?
questions.explanation: The post explicitly says 'Join ROASTR to earn $ROAST by daily checkin and roasting others!'

questions.question: Dan Romero praised the Gemini integration with which two specific Google productivity applications?
questions.explanation: He praised the 'Gemini Gmail and Gcal integration'.

questions.question: What did Dan Romero state he would specifically avoid installing before his flight on January 29th, 2026?
questions.explanation: He stated, 'I will not install balatro before this flight'.

questions.question: In the post comparing early internet journalism to crypto reporting (2022-11-08), which platform was cited as the source for the article?
questions.explanation: The article link provided points to 'https://www.quorummedia.xyz/'.

questions.question: Besides securely configuring Environment Variables & secrets, what other file-related feature was included in the Neynar Studio web update?
questions.explanation: The update included the ability to 'Browse files'.

questions.question: Brian Armstrong received bug reports for a huge UI refactoring through Beeper from which specific user mentioned in his post?
questions.explanation: He thanked '@mindlessmonk' for the reports.

questions.question: What did the official Base account confess about their revenue in March 2024?
options: They doubled their revenue and had no idea why.
They failed to hit their Q1 target.
It decreased due to market volatility.
It was exactly what was projected.
questions.explanation: The post starts with: 'last week we doubled our revenue and I have no idea why'.

questions.question: What tool/platform did Brian Armstrong ask `@neynar` to calculate his score on?
options: The platform they were currently casting on.
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong asked '@neynar what's my score', referring to a generalized metric likely related to Farcaster/Neynar activity.

questions.question: What major event or time period was the December 24th, 2025, App Studio updates timed for?
options: The end of the fiscal quarter.
questions.explanation: The updates were noted as 'Just in time App Studio updates for you to build something over the holidays ü™ê'.

questions.question: Dan Romero related the potential future obsolescence of video games for his kids to the current absurdity of using horses for transportation. What was the underlying technology driving this change, linked in his post?
options: Advanced AI modeling and research (Project Genie).
questions.explanation: He linked to a Google DeepMind blog post about 'Project Genie', which focuses on generative AI models.

questions.question: What did Brian Armstrong ask the robot to rate in his January 16th, 2026 post?
questions.explanation: Brian Armstrong asked: 'rate my undies @robot'.

questions.question: Jesse Pollak noted that the same tool powering simplified webhook filters on dev.neynar.com would also power what?
questions.explanation: The post says the 'same MCP tool powering it will also power the App Studio agent.'

questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak indicate was the primary motivation for putting Neynar Studio on the web?
questions.explanation: He mentioned moving Studio to the web 'for some more real estate'.

questions.question: Where did Mircea Pasoi (Coinbase) share thoughts regarding his discovery of being on the autism spectrum?
questions.explanation: He shared thoughts on his personal blog: 'https://mirceap.com/blog/how-i-discovered-i-have-autism'.
